posts.post_content:
I can see this in EDH and I really like the mana curve. Imagine T5 [Nobilis of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nobilis of War) drop and this following next turn. Those creatures alone would do 20 dmg, with evasion, but if you are playing boros, you likley have a whole horde of creatures out, making this card all that much more brutal.  
Well desinged, as a finished and mana cost is pretty balanced, I'd say. She's not overpowered, but she sure is very strong.

posts.post_content:
Probably the best R/W EDH general ever. Powerful on her own, synergistic with a whole bunch of stuff (good R/W aggressive creatures, equipment, pumps, etc.). And can just win the game out of nowhere with general damage thanks to haste and powerful double strike pumps.  
  
If only R/W had some decent card draw that wasn't so expensive...

posts.post_content: Uh, maybe I missed someone else mentioning it, but I think the absolute perfect card with Aurelia is [Frontline Medic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Frontline Medic). With all of your creatures attacking twice and indestructible, your opponent will have to really think about how he'll want to block, since none of your creatures will die and their creatures will take damage from both combat phases. Either that, or your opponent will simply die after both of these are on the board. There's that too.

posts.post_content:
Overall evaluation of each guild's hotties so far.  
Boros: [Arrows of Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arrows of Justice), [Aurelia, the Warleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia, the Warleader), [Boros Elite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Elite), [Firemane Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firemane Avenger), [Skyknight Legionaire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyknight Legionaire); Many, many hotties, but they all wear way too much armor. 4.5/5.  
Azorius: [Azorius Justicar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Justicar), [Isperia, Supreme Judge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isperia, Supreme Judge); Law is very unsexy, it seems. 1/5.  
Dimir: [Bane Alley Broker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bane Alley Broker), [Mental Vapors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mental Vapors), [Soul Ransom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Ransom), [Voidwalk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voidwalk); I have to imagine that the Dimir ladies are so pretty because they need to infiltrate the Izzet. 5/5.  
Izzet: [Blustersquall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blustersquall), [Counterflux](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterflux), [Electrickery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Electrickery), [Izzet Staticaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Staticaster); Ignoring [Electrickery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Electrickery), the Izzet ladies are very, very sexy. 5/5.  
Orzhov: [Cartel Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cartel Aristocrat), [D](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=D)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
@Aaronk: Obviously you haven't seen this little Boros mechanic called "Battalion" yet. Getting two Battalion triggers makes [Boros Elite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Elite) a 5/5, gets you another shot with [Firemane Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firemane Avenger), and allows you another attack with the conveniently empty field after you tapped all of their creatures with [Aurelia's Fury](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia's Fury). Most of the time, Boros opens the field for a single, glorious charge. This gives you a SECOND glorious charge for absolutely free.  
  
Plus, there are these funny things called Auras which you can put on Aurelia. Hrm. It's almost like they picked her name specifically to imply that you should do something, isn't it?
posts.html:
@Aaronk: Obviously you haven't seen this little Boros mechanic called "Battalion" yet. Getting two Battalion triggers makes Boros Elite a 5/5, gets you another shot with Firemane Avenger, and allows you another attack with the conveniently empty field after you tapped all of their creatures with Aurelia's Fury. Most of the time, Boros opens the field for a single, glorious charge. This gives you a SECOND glorious charge for absolutely free.

posts.post_content:
Why are people so excited about this card? It doesn't do anything. Getting an extra combat phase means they get to block twice as well. The only way this effect is beneficial is if you have better creatures, you have more creatures, or they have no creatures. In any of those cases - congratulations. You were already winning the game, you didn't need to spend six mana and a card to do nothing.  
  
Not to mention the fact that the body is just not good enough for its cost.
